Articles.Content: Okay guys, I just picked this game up, on a suggestion from a friend and it's freaking awesome! One problem, though. I'm doing career mode and it seems to be impossible to earn more than 6 science points. I've tried different combinations of parts and crew but I just don't ever earn science points after my first tech unlock. Any suggestions for this hapless n00b?
Use goo, take surface samples, crew reports, whatever. Should get more than 6 science.

What are you doing to get thIs science? Science points decrease rapidly for each time you repeat them. There are many combinations of experiments to be run. For example. You can run a crew report on the launch pad, and if you run a crew report while on the runway, this is classed as a different experiment. Then there are the mysterious goo and thermometer (and others) that you can run also. Check the kerbal wiki for more tips.

Science is abundant in KSP. Try using different science equipment (goo canister, thermometer, pressure meter, ) in different biomes. Later you can also upgrade your KSP building so you can do EVA's and pick up surface samples.

You don't have to watch all of them, the first few explain how science works.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/videoseries?list=PLYu7z3I8tdEkUeJRCh083UT-Lq5ZIKI75" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

The Kerbal Space Center(KSC) has a lot of small biomes, if you can walk a kerbal around to different buildings he can gather EVA reports and Surface Samples (right click the kerbal to do this)

In addition, if you can throw a small lander or roll a lander can out to some of those places with a science part and/or a kerbal inside you can gather even more by right clicking the parts and capsule.
Don't panic. It's not your fault. The game doesn't really explain this. I suggest watching the Scott Manley video above.
Also remember to aim higher, don't stick to KSC or kerbin, get in orbit, go to the mun, go to minimus, eventually go interplanetary if you really want science.

Sounds like you are only getting science from 'recover vessel' part.

There are dedicated science instruments (in the science tab in the VAB), and you can do a crew report in crew capsules, which yield science. Right click your crew capsule in flight.

In case you get lost, always remember that you can right click parts to activate/control them

Visit as many biomes as you can on each body you go to. You can get enough to get parts to go to Duna (and eve) just from kerbin, mun, minmus and surrounding space.

Take as many science instruments as you have at any given time.

It is tough to know what biome you may be on or if you visited it already until you are there.

Do crew reports every chance you get. 

Do eva reports.

Do collect surface sample.

Whenever I do a rescue mission, I have the rescuee do an eva report, and crew report before boarding the rescue craft.

Having a scientist along gives you a bonus on the science instrument results.
